snippet.title: Piers and Susanna argue as he labels Johnny Depp and Amber Heard 'spoilt brats'
snippet.description: Good Morning Britain turned awkward on Tuesday as Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid clashed over Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's upcoming libel trial court case.   Piers branded Hollywood actor Johnny and his ex wife Amber "spoiled brats" on this morning's edition of the ITV breakfast show leaving Susanna gobsmacked.  Pirates of the Caribbean star Johnny divorced Amber in 2017 after two years of marriage.  The American actress later filed a restraining order against her ex-husband alleging that she was "extremely afraid of him".  Depp is now suing The Sun newspaper for libel after it called him a "wife beater" in an article published by the publication about the couple in 2018.  Read More Related Articles  Read More Related Articles   The article in question related to Heard's allegation that her former spouse was violent towards her during their time as a married couple, claims Depp denies.  Speaking to GMB reporter Jonathan Swain this morning, outspoken presenter Piers raged that the case was a "waste of everyone's time".  He said: "I assumed this pandemic might crunch a few celebrity heads together and would make them realise that this kind of thing is pointless but no, here we go," Piers fumed. "But no, a circus will erupt.  "'Johnny hates Amber', 'Amber hates Johnny'. I don't care about any of them."  Read More Related Articles  Read More Related Articles   Susanna, 49, added: "It's a pretty unpleasant situation and the allegations at the heart of it are extremely serious."  Piers, 55, continued: "Yeah, but honestly. It's just a couple of celebrities..."  Co-star Susanna interrupted: "But the issue at the heart of it has to be taken seriously, whether you're a celebrity or not a celebrity."  Piers interjected: "The issue at the heart of it, which is domestic abuse"   "Which is hideous," Susanna interrupted.   He continued: "Has been completely trivialised by this case. If you've read even half of the stuff that come out already, it's quite clear that it was likely some ghastly, situation driven by drug abuse.  "And it diminishes people that go through real abuse, in my opinion. I just think it's absolutely unedifying and a waste of everyone's time, but that's where we are, isn't it?"  Piers and Susanna have presented GMB together since 2015 and the pair often argue live on-air.  Good Morning Britain airs weekdays on ITV at 6am
